column4: can anyone advise on what to do after booting from LiveCD and having to run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" to fix the monitor?
i'm at a loss and I can't find anything on the forums
charlie: i haven't gotten to the actual install portion
i'm just booting from the livecd
i boot from live CD, then it says I can't use X - so i run the reconfig, and then I am not sure what to do next
i've got a command line - but i dunno what to enter in to get ubunto to load from there
should i tell you about bash auto-complete too ?
bingo .. if you were doing it as you were typing xst you will see there is no such command as xstart
honestly , ubuntu isn't for geeks .. i would say other distros .. i would name no names :P
yes .. for your graphics card .. then install them
how do we tell you without you telling us your video card ?
search for it in synaptic or apt-cache ... there should be ubuntu driver without you compiling it.. and also pls do search on google
